page.title: 19CONSERVATION AREA PUTTENHAM
page.content: Puttenham, Wanborough and Compton are all within the{Green Belt}and are included in the Guildford Borough Local Plan published in 1983. This plan aims to preserve the landscape and protect the countryside. It promotes understanding of the historical and ecological value of the area, its significance as a wildlife habitat and the needs of agriculture. The villages of Compton and Puttenham are both designated{Conservation Areas and also{Areas of Outstanding Natural {Beauty.}Wanborough is a{Conservation {Area}and an{Area of Great Landscape {Value.}Puttenham Common, with its lakes, Monkgrove Copse and Compton Pit are all listed as{Sites of Special {Scientific Interest.}Puttenham Common North, where Nightjars nest, and Wanborough Wood are listed as being of {High Ecological Importance.
